newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgarian lev closes softer at 199.30/60 to dollar.
newsitem.headline: Bulgarian lev closes softer at 199.30/60 to dollar.

text.p: The Bulgarian lev closed at 199.30/60 per dollar, down from 199.10/30 at the open, due to a modest rise in foreign currency demand in a calm interbank forex market, dealers said.

"The lev eased to 199.50/60 at noon when foreign currency demand was at its peak but (the lev) soon recovered a bit," a dealer said, adding that banks were bidding on fairly small amounts for servicing clients.
Traders said the lev also regained some ground in early afternoon as dollar demand subsided and steadied at 199.30/60 in quiet trade until the close.

Dealers expected the lev's decline to continue next week. They said the market was still illiquid and pressure builds up on the lev each time demand appears, even for small volumes of foreign currency.
The lev closed at 194.20/30 a week ago and traded near 187 per dollar at the beginning of August. -- Sofia Newsroom, (++359-2) 981 8569
